statements.statement: As the marriage rate has fallen over the past four decades, household income has increased.
As median household incomes have increased, Marriage rates in people over 18 has decreased.
Since the 1960's, the gap in income, wealth, and marriage between blacks and whites has increased.
The income gap between whites and blacks has increased since 1970.
Between 1960 and 2012 the biggest gap between blacks and white has been shown in their median household wealth.
The gap in wealth inequality between whites and blacks is continuing to widen.
The household income, marriage rates and wealth all have declined over the years.
The median household wealth for whites spiked much higher than blacks in the middle of the last decade.
The median gap between white and black household income and wealth and marriage rates has widened, as the marriage in general rate has declined
Over the last few decades white households have continued to earn more income than black households.
The median household wealth between blacks and whites has not shifted dramatically between the 1980s and the 2011.
The earning Gap between Whites and Blacks has remained steady since 1960 till the recent data of 2011
The marriage rate for both white and black people has decreased over a span of 50 years.
There is still a large financial gap between whites and blacks
The gaps between median income, marriage rate, and median household wealth between whites and blacks have steadily risen over the past 50 years.
The gap in median household income, marriage rate, and median household wealth between whites and blacks have all grown.
From 1960 to 2011, economic disparity between blacks and whites widened in three key categories: median household income, median household wealth and the marriage rate.
The median household wealth between Whites and Blacks seems to be widening as the years progress.
Trends are showing that whites income and wealth are increasing while black income and wealth remains relatively unchanged.
Financially speaking, the gap between whites and blacks is increasing.
Over the last five years, even as the gap between black and white median income has remained about the same, the gap in median household wealth has been closing.
Blacks have never had, and continue not to have any household wealth.
The darker gray shaded area bounded between the two lines is the best visualization trend.
The widest social gap between Blacks and Whites in America has been in median household wealth, and it peaked around 2005.
Economic conditions for blacks (when compared to whites) have not improved over the last 30 years.
The largest gap is in Marriage Rate because it has the largest difference compared to the other graphs.
Median house wealth has increased dramatically between the 80's and 2012 for white while blacks has remained the same.
As the gap between incomes of Whites versus Blacks widens, so does the gap between them in regards to marriage rate.
Not only is there still a gap between blacks and whites in terms of marriage rates and wealth, it's gotten worse over the last twenty years.
The biggest gap in household wealth between blacks and whites happened between 2000 and 2011.

nuggets.nugget: Median household wealth for blacks has been relatively constant since 1960.
Median household income has increased for whites and blacks since 1960.
The gap in marriage rate between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
Median household income spiked for whites in the 90's and early 2000's but has since dropped dramatically.
Marriage rate has decreased for whites and blacks since 1960.
Median household wealth isn't much different for whites or blacks than it was in 1960.
The gap in household wealth between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
Marriage rates have steadily decreased since 1960.
The gap in median household income between whites and blacks has grown between 1960 and 2011.
The gap between whites and blacks in median household wealth peaked in the mid 2000's.
There exists a financial gap between blacks and whites.
